lexUnit.name: pathetic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: arousing pity, especially through vulnerability or sadness.

sentence.text: Where he becomes ridiculous is in his desperate ambition to be part of the working class , striking a rather pathetic figure as he sits in his ministerial office with his trade union banner behind his head .
Alien in themselves , they represent a rather pathetic attempt to enliven city centres which are essentially lifeless .
Sporadically , Katherine Mansfield conveys the volatile atmosphere in the comfortable apartment and Beatrice emerges as a deluded and rather pathetic exhibitionist .
It seemed rather pathetic , but they never permitted you to feel sorry for them .
OK , so it spawned a slew of pathetic imitators , but they 're all gone now and ` Psychocandy " still remains -- black and hard and juddering , the guitar highpoint of the '80s .
The relief in his voice was pathetic .
It was a pathetic sight .
His main companion is the pathetic dreg of society , Ratso Rizzo .
Once there was a wayside inn , now a pathetic ruin .
It is a pathetic and lamentable contrast to the vital contribution made by the arts at previous Expos in , for example , Paris in 1900 and 1937 , or Montreal in 1967 .
It 's horrible — it 's really pathetic .
It is pathetic to see Bedivere the bold in such a state .
Or maybe it had n't been so pathetic .
` It is bad enough doing that to the uninitiated , but to do it to the Secretary of State is really beyond the pale -- it 's quite pathetic . "
“ … I think we owe it to that pathetic creature in there . ”
Unfortunately , pity for that poor pathetic creature began to creep into her kind heart .
Kelly stared at the pathetic figure for a moment and then let him go .
Similarly we may see the nutter as a pathetic figure who has to resort to self-humiliation in order to establish an identity for himself .
Her father was on the brink of alcoholism , a pathetic figure who could only face life if he had a bottle in his hand .
She thought he looked a pathetic figure of a man .
In an inexplicable way , the lad looked a pathetic sight .

Over a period of three hundred years , black people have achieved a growing presence in sport in Britain yet it seems pathetic that we have no account for it apart from reference to the mysterious attribute called natural ability .
` My flowers seem pathetic by comparison . "
He does a most pathetic act , limping .
In this pathetic condition it is completely immune to any pain that may be inflicted upon it .
One minute we are reciting the most orthodox creed and the next minute we are practising a pathetic view of God which would do no credit to a pagan .
It was love he felt -- and not only for her : for the pathetic room , the faded carpet , the floor boards , the stove , everything .
He would not be prepared when she asked him why he had sent two men to beat up a pathetic hotel clerk and frighten a vulnerable old woman .
The dogs live in appalling conditions , open to the weather , walking on wires , lying on excrement , they rarely exercise and often make pathetic attempts to escape .
I think this whole thing of racing off to get divorced at the first snag you hit seems pathetic . "
They 're pathetic , a paradox to themselves .
She , in turn , would become more and more pathetic and martyr-like , like her mother .
